;

;On the stage of the third season of "Summer of the Band", the song "Big Dream" made the Waina band popular, and there were many invitations to perform. This debut has been for more than 10 years The band has become a very popular new face this summer. The lives of the three members are filled with various schedules, which are far more intense than the busy schedule of farming. Before they stand on the stage, they live in the ground. Ban farmers are busy planting in spring. Passers-by work as bricklayers on construction sites all year round, and occasionally go to the streets to sing and sing. Shiba was farming in his hometown and working as a street singer in Guilin.

;

;In order to maintain the order of life as much as possible in Vaina's busy life, the three members have agreed to spend half the month wandering outside and the other half living at home. For now, they are still looking for a new rhythm. Lu Min and Shiba have not yet adapted to the sudden increase in cameras and flashlights. They feel uncomfortable facing the camera, their eyes flicker, and they don't speak much.

;

;Not long ago, Shiba went to the streets to sing, spending half the time singing and the other half taking photos with the audience. He made a promise to himself: go there at least once a month. "After all, it's been 18 years since I first started singing."

;

;In September 2023, "Big Dream" - using age as a node, written from birth to death, has every age Duan's Dilemma - Before the stage broadcast, we conducted an exclusive interview with the Waina band. They detailed the beginning and end of the establishment of the Waina band and the lives of the three individuals. But at that time, there was still a short period of time before they really became popular, and they belonged to the "former Waina".

;

;Will they change?

;

;Real creation is a portrayal of people’s sense of distance on the land of this era

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;You performed outstandingly in "Summer of the Band". Although it has been 10 years since your debut, you are a new face to the public. What do you think of this “newness”? ;

;

;;Vayna: ;;The reason why we went to participate was just for a stage. I have loved writing songs for a long time, but I haven’t had the opportunity to communicate with everyone. This stage allows us to freely express our original attitudes. Sing the songs we want to sing authentically. ;

;

;From the perspective of Lumin and Shiba, they are indeed young and new. And I (;Editor's note: Banong;) have been singing for many years, and I just want to say that this is the first time everyone has heard it. Some of our songs have a different angle from the songs that everyone often hears, and (the audience) has a new feeling. But it is not new to us. We have always been ourselves. What is new (in the eyes of the audience) is something very old about us. It has always been some of our emotions and states of life.

;

;;

;

;Ban farmers inspect old rice varieties in their fields;(Photo provided by interviewee);

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;After getting on this stage, will the invitations and performances that are pouring in come to me? Destroy your rhythm of life and affect your original attitude? ;

;

;;Waina:;;If we don’t have a clear direction, we will be destroyed, but if we have a good direction, it is not destruction; To help us build the state we want, it mainly depends on how we grasp it. ;

;

;We still pay more attention to our own lives, and now we have agreed to spend half a month living at home and half a month doing more communication outside. Of course, this half-month plan is a regular plan. If you are busy with farming or have something to do at home, you can adjust it slightly.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Will your creations be affected? ;

;

;;Vayna: ;;It’s still land, it’s the relationship between land and people, it’s something real (things) related to life, coming from experience A little more stuff. We prefer to express some emotions from contemporary real life, rather than purely creating or imagining something. This kind of thing derived from reality also has artistic modification techniques. But man is a thing on the land and has a close relationship with the land. Many of people's sorrows today may be a sequelae of a certain separation between people and the land. People must be inseparable from a relationship with the land and life as a whole, including the countryside and the city. If your creation is real, it must be a portrayal of a person's sense of distance on the land in this era. ;

;

;We have no limits on what we want to create, but there may be a starting point. The Wayna band wants to retain the style of Wayna, but we all have other creations privately, some very different creations based on personal hobbies. But in Waina, it is better not to go off topic. Like when we sing now, we have a little interaction, but in fact I (;Editor's note: Banong ;) Make some pure music, which is not very similar to Waina’s songs. I have also tried a lot of electronic music. Therefore, we limit our vision to the countryside and describe some changes in people and nature, people and society in contemporary rural areas. This is the main style.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;A song like "Big Dream" is not considered traditional Waina style, but it has attracted many people now. Will your future creations be biased? ;

;

;;Waina: ;;It is still close to a portrayal of real life, like "Grandma Returns" written by Lu Min. That song is Hakka. But Waina is from the Zhuang ethnic group, so that’s fine. It’s still a very rural and authentic creation. The so-called reality means that it is like something growing out of the ground. It does not mean that we just make a flower. Of course, that is also a kind of beauty and a kind of consciousness, but Wayna prefers this aspect (reality). ;

;

;(Everyone likes "Big Dream") It's okay, everyone likes it. Let's just sing "Big Dream" three times first and then sing country. Good.

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Are you satisfied with your current life? ;

;

;;Vayna: ;;It mainly depends on how to design. Everything has to be redesigned. There is no fixed life or a satisfactory life for you. , you should (adjust) it based on comfort and realism at any time, and don’t drift. We are quite free and can allocate our time as much as possible. If you want to go out and sing tonight, you can go out. If you don't want to go out, you can't go out. Take the initiative to do things without getting tired. It’s a bit hard to be regulated and do it. It was difficult for me to eat because I was probably trying to sleep at the time. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Waina Band was not a banker at the beginning , Lu Min and Shiba 3 members, will you stick to the current lineup in the future? ;

;

;;Vayna: ;;This is sometimes like asking whether you will get divorced after getting married? I feel like it's flowing, don't try to kidnap a band. I hope that everyone will do something with their heart wherever they go, instead of just doing it for the sake of making money. Regardless of whether we stay together or not, everyone can continue to sing and live life truthfully. This is the most important thing. If the three of us get tired of our relationship and want to break up, then we will break up. But it doesn’t matter. From now on Shiba can continue to write good songs, I can continue to make music, and Lu Min can continue to sing the songs he wants to sing. This has nothing to do with whether we break up or not. The important thing is to always maintain the expression and experience of life. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;You enjoy the feeling of being photographed in front of the camera ? ;

;

;;Vayna:;;（;Shakes his head; );

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;Do you usually like to take pictures? ;

;

;;Wayna:;;（;岜农;) Usually I can take pictures if I want to. I still like to take pictures of picking wild fruits and pricking them. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;What do you think is the standard for a good photo? ;

;

;;Waina:;;Sometimes I look through my hard drive and find some photos that I thought were interesting at the time and beautifully posed, but in fact they are not. use. What's really useful? I did it, I filmed it. It reminded me of the actual experience and feelings of doing that thing. ;

;

;;Southern People Weekly:;;How do you define a perfect life? ;

;

;;Vayna: ;;Everyone should be different. He should find his most comfortable state, live freely, and be able to realize the meaning of life. Everyone is looking for that spot in him, and I found it early on. ;

;

;The word "full marks" divides life. From the perspective of the whole life, every stage is a part of your life, just like a river. Which section do you like best? Waters? In fact, no stretch of water represents the river. I think every individual is a perfect score. If you can love yourself and let go like this, you will be a perfect score.

;;Doctoral profile:;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping, the first doctor of military law in New China. ;

;

;;Born in 1966 in Yudu County, Ganzhou, Jiangxi. ;

;

;;September 1984-July 1988, studied at the Nanchang Army Academy of the Chinese People's Liberation Army , received a bachelor's degree in military science. ;

;

;;1988-1995, successively;;Served as an officer of the People's Liberation Army stationed in Zhangzhou, Fujian and an instructor at Nanchang Army Academy. ;

;

;;September 1995-July 1998, studied at Xi'an Political College and received a bachelor's degree in law Master's degree. ;

;

;;From 1998 to 2004, he served as an instructor at Nanchang Army Academy and a military lawyer. ;

;

;;September 2004-January 2007, studied at China University of Political Science and Law, receiving a bachelor's degree in law Ph.D. ;

;

;;From January 2007 to August 2018, he served as professor and senior professor of Nanchang Institute of Technology Professor, Dean and Vice President of the School of Political Science and Law. From July to August 2010, he served as a visiting scholar at the China Research Service Center of the Chinese University of Hong Kong. ;

;

;;April 2012-April 2013, at the University of California, Hastings He served as a visiting scholar at the School of Law (now the University of California, San Francisco School of Law) and the U.S. Institute of Military Justice. ;

;

;;August 2018-January 2019, served as the Faculty of Law, Xiamen University Kah Kee College professor. ;

;

;;From February 2019 to January 2022, he served as the Wenzheng College of Soochow University/Suzhou City Professor of the Department of Law and Political Science of the college. ;

;

;;From February 2023 to present, he serves as a professor at the Law School of Guangzhou Business School. ;

;

;;

;

;Zeng Zhiping is China’s first doctor of military law. (Photo courtesy of interviewee)

;

;Among the PhDs interviewed, Zeng Zhiping may be the last to obtain a PhD. In January 2007, he graduated early from China University of Political Science and Law and became China's first doctor of military law - 24 years had passed since the first batch of doctors trained after the reform and opening up were awarded degrees.

;

;In fact, as a secondary discipline under the category of law, the process of military law becoming a discipline is relatively late.

;

;In 1984, legal scholars Zhang Youyu and Pan Nianzhi first proposed that military law is a branch of the legal system in the "Encyclopedia of China·Law Volume"; three years later, in May 1987, the former State Education Commission Military law was officially listed as a branch discipline of law; in 1993, the Military Law Department of Xi'an Political College (now the Xi'an Campus of the Political College of the National Defense University of the Chinese People's Liberation Army), the country's first teaching institution specializing in military legal education, was established, marking the establishment of the Department of Military Law. Military law professional education is officially on the right track.

;

;In 2003, Xi'an Political College became the first school with the right to award a doctorate in military law; in the same year, China University of Political Science and Law opened a military law research center. In 2004, China University of Political Science and Law began to recruit doctoral students in military law. Also in this year, Zeng Zhiping, who had the rank of lieutenant colonel, transferred from Nanchang Army College and was admitted to China University of Political Science and Law in September of the same year, becoming the only doctoral student in military law enrolled that year.

;

;Zeng Zhiping studied under Professor Zhou Jian, a well-known expert in the field of military law and the first director of the Military Law Teaching and Research Office in China. Zhou Jian once pointed out in an article: "Among the top ten legal disciplines identified by the Ministry of Education, military law (030110) can be said to be the one with the least talents and the most difficult to research."

;

;Compared with law Among other majors, military law is a relatively mysterious and niche subject. Before changing careers, Zeng Zhiping worked in the army for 21 years. In a sense, it was his status as a soldier that gave him the opportunity to specialize in military law.

;

;In Zeng Zhiping’s view, today’s “openness” of military law is related to the atmosphere of the rule of law and the society’s demand for military legal talents.

;

;Military academy, army, and then to military academy

;

;;Southern Weekend:;; In 1984, you were admitted to Nanchang Army College (now the Army Infantry College of the Chinese People's Liberation Army) as an undergraduate student. Why did you choose a military school at that time? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;In our time, especially in rural areas, everyone’s life was not guaranteed. The ones with relatively better treatment were the military. . When I graduated from high school, I participated in the military draft. At that time, I was recruited to be a pilot, and the requirements were relatively high. I was rejected during the physical examination. When Nanchang Army Academy came to recruit students, the head teacher recommended me. I didn’t have any particularly strong ideas at the time, but my father thought it would be good to be an officer, so he went for it. If you want to say that I have any strong (ideas) towards the military or officers, I don’t think I have any. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What is special about undergraduate education in military academies? ? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping:;;Before I went to the military academy, I didn’t know much about the military or the military academy, but physical training was the most beneficial thing for me in the military academy. When I first went to school, I couldn't do any pull-ups. The school organized physical training, and during the training process, I made the fastest progress. Later, I became an all-around athlete in school and also participated in military sports competitions. Some of the teachers are from the army and will teach tactics, shooting, military fitness, formation and the like. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;After graduating from Nanchang Army Academy, what did you do Which jobs? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;After graduation, I was sent to the front-line army in Zhangzhou, Fujian. At that time, I was a platoon leader in a regiment. After a few months, I was transferred to the agency. During the training of all division cadres, the instructor of one training subject did not demonstrate accurately, so the regiment leader "picked" me out. Later, I became an instructor for many projects. This (experience) made me stand out. ;

;

;I have been in the front-line army for four and a half years. I have served as an officer in the Organizational Section of the Political Department and as an instructor. After the Lantern Festival in 1993, I was transferred to Nanchang Army Academy to teach, which I applied for on my own initiative. At that time, I went to the Marxist-Leninist Teaching and Research Office, and the director of the Military Teaching and Research Office asked me: "Why don't you come to me?" He was my instructor when I was a student.

;

;In school, I taught Introduction to International Politics when I first arrived because there were relatively few teachers taking this course at that time. I was also interested in the introduction to law class, and after one semester, I was teaching introduction to law.

;

;Discipline Positioning

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Why will you continue? Study law on your own? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;It’s a bit of a coincidence that something happened in the spring of 1993 that had a great impact on college students across the country: the International College Debate Competition , the one Jiang Changjian and the others participated in. It was really interesting for us to watch this competition at that time. Jiang Changjian majored in National Politics, so I wanted to go to Fudan to study for a graduate degree in International Politics. ;

;

;But later at school, I learned that several young men we hung out with were preparing to take the bar exam. I felt that this matter was definitely the right thing to do. After weighing it, I said that I would study law instead of international politics. International politics is a "dragon-slaying art" and law is more practical. In 1994, I began to study law on my own in accordance with the requirements of the bar qualification examination syllabus. In October of that year, I ranked first in the military and qualified as a lawyer. ;(Southern Weekend Note: The national judicial examination system had not yet been established at that time, and you could obtain lawyer qualifications by passing the bar qualification examination.);;

;When I took the postgraduate entrance examination, I was not afraid of majors related to law. Because I had already passed the bar exam and my brain was good at that time, I thought I could pass the exam for any major.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You already teach in a military academy, why do you want to study for a master's degree? ? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping:;;I had not thought about leaving the army at that time, but I did want to leave Nanchang Army Academy. Many professors in the school are older. I feel that if I don’t leave the school, I may not be as good as them when I get older. However, it is still relatively difficult to transfer to the army. The postgraduate entrance examination is a means of leaving school. ;

;

;I wanted to take the international law major at Wuhan University, but someone told me that if you study as a graduate student at a local university, you have to go back to your original school after graduation, because it is impossible for local universities to You stay. So I chose Xi'an Political College, which is also a military school.

;

;Now that I think about it, if I had gone to Wuhan University from the beginning, my academic foundation might have been more reliable. If I received systematic academic training when I was young and read a lot of books, then my most source knowledge would be complete and my academic research would have a beginning and an end. My current knowledge cannot reach this level, which is a lifelong regret of mine. Now I mainly feel that my years have been wasted.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When you were studying for a master's degree, what did you know about military law? Do you have any idea about what kind of disciplines and what kind of problems are to be solved? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;This is true because I have a background in law. I have read a lot of materials before and also studied military law. In my master's degree, my direction is military justice, mainly studying the military prosecutorial system. What impressed me most was that I read a lot of English materials at that time and discussed with some famous professors the structure of criminal theory of the three levels of German and Japanese criminal law. This also had a great influence on me. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You developed a love for military law during your Ph.D. ? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;I can’t say it’s love. I just accumulated knowledge to a certain extent and have an understanding of this subject. On the other hand, I see a lot of work that is poorly written. I feel that my participation in this subject may make it better. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Let’s go back to discuss the positioning of the discipline of military law Question, do you think it belongs to the branch of military science or the branch of law? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;It depends on how you treat belonging. This issue can be discussed from the subject management of the Ministry of Education, from the professional fields involved in the subject, and from the classification of knowledge. I only recognize the classification of knowledge. ;

;

;;

;

;2022 In June of this year, Zeng Zhiping (fifth from left) was with students at Wenzheng College of Soochow University. (Photo provided by interviewee)

;

;“I am also a product of the times”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;When you graduated with a master's degree, your original plan was to continue on the academic path? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;No, before graduation, I want to go to the Shanghai Military Procuratorate or leave the original school. At that time, I returned to Nanchang and took an introduction to law class at school. Because there were several teachers taking the same course, I could only attend a few classes in one semester. In addition to taking classes at the military academy, I was also teaching part-time at several private universities. It can be said that teaching has nourished my psychology. In private universities, many students look at you with hungry and passionate eyes, which is different from what I encountered at my original school. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Then why did you go to China University of Political Science and Law? Where's Beau? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;This is a bit of a coincidence. I had always wanted to change my job before the Spring Festival in 2004, but at that time the unit leader had not announced our job. There is news that I can change my job, I am just applying. At that time, I saw the information about various schools recruiting Ph.D.s, and I was thinking, "Will it be approved (for career change) this year?" Around January 10, 2004, after my application for job change was approved, I quickly checked the admissions information of various schools. I had always wanted to go to Wuhan University, but the registration had closed at that time. However, that year, because the Chinese Political Science and Law added a new doctoral program in military law, its registration period was extended, so I signed up. ;

;

;When looking at school admissions information, I will also consult some teachers. I met Teacher Zhou Jian when I was studying at Xi'an Political College, and I called him. I originally wanted to major in criminal law, and I have been teaching criminal law. Then teacher Zhou Jian said, you don’t want to major in criminal law. I teach military law in China’s political and legal field, so you can study military law with me.

;

;I also told Teacher Zhou, "I have changed careers, why should I study military law? I am still more interested in criminal law." Therefore, military law is really a product of the times, and I am also a product of the times. It is a coincidence.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Was the competition fierce to apply for a doctorate in military law at China University of Political Science and Law? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping:;;At that time, China University of Political Science and Law had three professors who could teach PhD students in military law, but that year only Professor Zhou Jian enrolled students, and the quota only one person. I was particularly impressed. There were 10 people who signed up at that time. I also checked the scores of other candidates using the score checking rules. ;

;

;The rule for checking scores at that time was to just enter your admission ticket number. According to the numbering method of the admission ticket number, the first digits are the same, and the difference is in the last single digits and tens digits. Based on where we were in the exam room at that time, I could probably guess how many people were in front of me and behind me. After I checked my scores, I guessed their numbers, and I actually found out my scores. Seeing that the second place was 20 points lower than me, I felt more relaxed.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;How will it be for you to get a doctorate from China University of Political Science and Law? Something more important? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;Yes, this is a very important turning point in life. At that time, I changed my career and had a doctorate in military law. Teacher Zhou said, China’s political and legal affairs will definitely keep you, so my life plan at that time had a general direction. ;

;

;When I was studying for my master's degree, I once went to Beijing. While reading in the Beijing Library, I met an old gentleman. He went to an event at Peking University and we had a brief chat. He said something to the effect of "If I can go to Peking University to be a professor in this life, I can do whatever I want." I had a very imaginary idea at that time: It would be great if I could become a professor of political science and law in China, so sometimes life is very strange.

;

;Of course, there were some changes later, and I did not stay at China University of Political Science and Law after graduation.

;

;Cognition is the core of personality

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;You Studying for a master's degree is to leave the original school; studying for a doctorate is to stay in a new school. So these choices you made were not based on professional choices? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;Yes, I have always wanted to teach in a better university, but people are like duckweeds of the times. My current thoughts may be more mature thoughts, because my career is nearing the "end". I think it is like this: you need to go to school, your school, the teachers and classmates you meet should work together to help you find your interests in life. ;

;

;So I think an ideal society should be one where everyone is encouraged to do what you want to do and find your interests and passions. If every young person's growth is to learn based on his own love, then this will enhance his love.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;"The first doctor of military law after the founding of New China" label, for Has it had a big impact on your life? ;

;

;;Zeng Zhiping: ;;I didn’t realize this when I graduated. In 2007, my son was going to take the college entrance examination. My simple thought was, can I graduate early? If I stay in China Political Science and Law, it will be very convenient for my son to go to school in Beijing. But my son didn't think it was necessary. He got good grades and was admitted to Wuhan University. But I finished my thesis and graduated half a year ahead of schedule. I didn’t mean to be the first. ;

;

;I passed the graduation thesis defense in the morning, and the "Legal Daily" reported it in the afternoon. Later, some foreign media also followed up and reported the matter. It still seems very interesting now. I don't know if foreign media have paid attention to the first doctoral doctors of other disciplines, but at that time, many foreign media reported my report on my paper title "On Military Organization", saying that I am right to be right. Such a major theoretical problem made a good study.

;

; I haven't told this tag to others myself. Or do some publicity.

;

; ; Southern Weekend: ; ; After graduating from Dr. you, he applied for Nanchang Institute of Technology and was ordered to form Nanchang Institute of Technology The Department of Political and Law of the College. Compared with the "Five Institutes and Four Departments" in the legal community, what do you think is the legal department of a private university? ;

;

; ; Zeng Zhiping: ; ; My Nanchang Institute of Technology in 2007, I got the National Social Science Fund in 2008. At that time, there were only a dozen universities with legal departments and laws in Jiangxi, so it had a great impact. For a long time, the school regarded me as a signboard. ;

;

; In undergraduate education, I am very conscious. I did not take military law in the professional courses of law undergraduate. If you are the director yourself, the dean of the law school, and then start your class into a professional course, compile the textbook, and let everyone buy your book. This is very face -to -face. Until now, I have not compiled a textbook for military law.

;

; I started courses according to the most basic undergraduate majors. If you want to say something special, you can say that I have a very critical lesson in a few generals: ordinary logic, grammatical rhetoric, political introduction, and sociology. universal.

;

; In 2016, we became a master's degree awarding construction unit in Jiangxi Province, which was issued by the relevant unit. I want students to receive good education, which is also a relatively direct work.

;

; In fact, the sense of accomplishment in teaching also gives me the motivation to continue. Why do I insist on teaching? It is because I think there are many mistakes now, and teaching is also a wrong teaching. Sometimes I say it negatively. Although I am definitely not Popular (popular), I can make those virtual Popular be eliminated because I squeeze a position and make his virtual popular less one less one less. Location.

;

; I stick to it correctly, this is what I mean.

;

; ; Southern Weekend: ; ; What experience or ideas do you want to share with the current college students? ;

;

; ; Zeng Zhiping: ; ; People are hard to escape the fate of the duckweed. However, it is always different whether it is conscious. After all, cognition is the core of personality. ;

;On November 16, 2023, in the Donetsk region, unmanned troops of the Ukrainian army Aircraft operators are training not far from the front line ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Recently, the Ukrainian military claimed that it had Soldiers drove out their positions on the east bank of the Dnieper River in the occupied Kherson area and established multiple bridgeheads. Russia also admitted for the first time that the Kiev army had crossed the Dnieper River.

;

;This is of course a result worthy of attention, because the establishment of a bridgehead on the east bank of the Dnieper River poses a great threat to Crimea. If Ukraine can deploy long-range weapons on the east bank, Crimea may It’s hard to stick with it.

;

;General Zaluzhny, Commander-in-Chief of the Ukrainian Armed Forces, emphasized in an interview with The Economist that Ukraine needs to develop and deploy its own advanced technology to regain the upper hand in the war. Behind the establishment of the bridgehead It is the tactical advantages brought about by a series of technological updates, especially in electronic countermeasures.

;

;After the outbreak of the Russo-Ukrainian War, Ukraine has been engaged in invisible electronic countermeasures with Russia. The battle in the Kherson area is the forefront of this confrontation, because the two sides can often only use it across the river. Long-range firepower exchanges, so drones become the key to victory, because both sides rely heavily on drones to find targets and correct artillery. Whoever can use electronic countermeasures to suppress the opponent's drones will gain an advantage in the battle.

;

;Currently, the most efficient way to fight drones is to suppress them through electromagnetic interference, which will directly cause the drone to crash. It has been previously reported that the area near the Dnieper River has become a no-fly zone for drones, because both sides will use electronic jamming methods to suppress and interfere with the flight of drones. On this invisible battlefield, the two sides have been engaged in a very complex and cruel battle. .

;

;For nearly a century, electromagnetic interference has been an important part of warfare. Traditional electronic warfare methods are to find the radio frequencies being used by the enemy and create overwhelming noise on the same frequencies, making it impossible for the opponent to attack use. In World War II, electronic warfare mainly targeted radio communications and radar. As long as the opponent was unable to communicate and detect, the mission was completed.

;

;Modern communication technology has developed various means to combat electronic interference, but the main reason is not just for electronic warfare, but because there are a large number of electromagnetic signal sources in human society. During World War II, a 50-watt radio could easily carry out point-to-point communications in China and even East Asia. However, now it is difficult for a 50-watt radio to cover even one province - this is not because the radios back then were more advanced, but because the radios were more advanced. It was because the electromagnetic environment was good back then.

;

;Electromagnetic communication can be regarded as a conversation between two parties. If the room is very quiet, the two parties can hear what the other party is saying without making a loud sound. If there are not only many people chatting in the room, but also people watching movies, shooting balls, playing and singing, then the two parties must raise their voices or be very close to each other when communicating. The reason why modern communication technology attaches great importance to anti-interference is because the electromagnetic background environment is too complex, making it impossible to complete communication simply by increasing power.

;

;Software technology is also improving. For example, in the past, changing the frequency and signal characteristics of a radio station required replacing hardware. However, with the softwareization of radios, only changing the encoding can completely change the spectrum of the equipment. In other words, problems that in the past required major repairs after being interfered with can now only be solved by adding a patch to the software, or even reusing the software to replace the encryption method. In the past, to change the encryption method, each receiving end needed to change the machine.

;

;UAVs used in the military generally use more complex control methods to combat interference. For example, frequency hopping is used to connect back-end control, which can skip the interfered frequency band. This is commonly used in radio communications. Anti-interference means; you can also use inertial navigation in the case of interference, continue to execute the original flight path, and then connect satellite navigation and rear control when the interference weakens.

;

;Of course, as the ability to resist interference becomes stronger, the ability to resist interference will also become stronger accordingly. Spears and shields compete with each other and develop with each other.

;

;Theoretically, as long as your electronic warfare capabilities are strong enough, you can construct an electronic golden bell that prevents all drones from flying in and prevents precision-guided weapons from hitting targets in the golden bell. If the interferer's equipment reaches 100% power, anti-interference methods are often difficult to work.

;

;But the reality is that interference means cannot provide full-level signals in all areas, which depends on the location of the interference source, the orientation of the antenna and its own power. The drone is a mobile platform that can continuously fly for reconnaissance and interfere with weak signal locations to find better flight routes.

;

;And sometimes the problem can be solved in less "electronic" ways, such as using radio triangulation to directly find the approximate location of the interference source, and using long-range firepower to cover the opponent, even if it misses the target. It can force the opponent to shut down temporarily to avoid the blow.

;

;In short, there are many tactics in actual combat that can weaken the effect of the opponent's electronic interference, and these tactics themselves are also an important part of electronic warfare. Therefore, there is no omnipotent secret weapon. On the invisible battlefield of electronic warfare, only by continuously strengthening technology and constantly changing and updating countermeasures can we gain an advantage in action.

;

;By the time Byatt completed Possession, publishers on both sides of the Atlantic were deeply troubled and almost sceptical. "They begged me to cut out those poems and writings about the Victorian era. The only American publisher brave enough to accept it reminded me: 'You ruin all the suspense with these cumbersome words.' Early in the morning, I cried. . Later, the novel won the Booker Prize, to everyone's surprise (including myself), it became a bestseller, and people wrote essays using my imaginary poet. "Possession" was translated into thirty Multiple languages. I owe Eco a huge debt."

;

;;

;

;Matisse's story;;

;

;;Still Life;

;

;Byatt once said in an exclusive interview with the New York Times: "I am not an academic who accidentally wrote a novel. In fact, I happen to be a moderately academic novelist."

;

;Byatt's early literary creations were modeled after George Eliot and Iris Murdoch. Like the former, she regards novels as an ideal art form because "you can absorb the whole world from them"; influenced by the latter, she tries to portray characters who are entangled and struggling with various ideas; at the same time, following the example of her two predecessors, she admires Utter writes dense, detailed novels that are challenging to read even for her smart, patient fans.

;

;"The difficulty lies in the fact that sentences like this can be seen everywhere: a dense collection of unknown knowledge and the author's delicate and rigorous subjective feelings; specialized terms in the fields of classics, mythology and art are randomly picked up... ...long sentences contain alternating long and short clauses...familiar words have long-abandoned meanings or obscure meanings." Yang Xiangrong, the translator of Byatt's works, once "complained" that the translation of "The Virgin in the Garden" was difficult, But I was impressed, "When I read it for the second time, I gradually fell in love with the complex and regular language style, the unremitting capture of subtleties, and the almost aristocratic style of writing in which the writer never creates simple sentences. Restraint."

;

;;

;

;The Virgin in the Garden

;

;In 1978, "The Virgin in the Garden" was published. Byatt inscribed on the title page - "Dedicated to me" The son of Charles Byatt (1961.7.19-1972.7.22)." "I came up with the idea of ​​​​creating "Virgin in the Garden" around 1961, when my son was born. I suddenly realized that I had experienced a certain period. History."

;

;Byatt set the background of "The Virgin in the Garden" in 1953, when Queen Elizabeth II ascended the throne. In the very short time span from rehearsal, performance to completion of a historical drama, Bo The three children of the Te family have undergone fundamental changes. The eldest daughter Stephanie got married and had a child, the 18-year-old second daughter Frederica lost her virginity, and the youngest son Marcus was deceived and became insane... They all experienced dangerous growth. .

;

;At the beginning of the novel, Byatt begins with "National Portrait Gallery: 1968", "I experienced the early 1950s. I lived in the 1960s, and I don't regard the 1960s as A time for a revolution, but as a time when I can look back on the history in which I lived... What is personal is not political, although the participants in politics are individuals. Politics is not personal at all.";

;In 1972, Byatt's son Charles, who was just over 11 years old, died suddenly in a car accident on his way to school. After losing her beloved son, she experienced landslides and ice cracks in her life. She wrote a sentence at the end of the prologue of the novel. A woman whose son was seriously injured in the collision said, "That woman used to be a good teacher, but not anymore. She used to have many friends, but now she doesn't have them. She used to have a lovable body, but now she doesn't. She was scared and angry. Exhausted, I can't let go for a moment..."

;

;;< /p>;

;Still Life

;

;In 1985, Byatt published "Still Life". The scene in the first chapter of the novel is set in obstetrics and gynecology. In the hospital, while waiting for a prenatal check-up, Stephanie witnessed the miscarriage of another woman beside her. The little life ended, "motionless and silent"... Stephanie gave birth successfully, but when she was looking forward to a new life, she was accidentally electrocuted. Death. The English title of the novel "Still Life" is interpreted literally - "still life" - that is, death. In the book, Byatt once lamented through the mouth of a character: "Perhaps, we can also look at still life in this way. The so-called still life painting is synonymous with natural death."

;

;"I have already conceived it. Stephanie's death in 1961. I thought I was going to write a series of novels in which I would make that death a central awareness, so that readers would feel the pain of a real death, as you did, rather than having to deal with a real death. A fictional death. Every two or three months I get a letter from a reader saying, how dare you do this to me. I sit down and cry all night long. You know, you have no right to kill in a novel like Real people kill people like that. That's not fair."

;

;;Resisting "The Winter's Tale";

;

;——What's the point of surviving one day and another? What kind of life.

;

;——The lives of many people.

;

;Byatt's "Female Growth Quartet" which took 30 years to complete has a certain autobiographical color. Among them, the obvious main line is the growth and awakening of the intellectual woman Frederica. This series of novels explores almost all the confusions and issues that women face throughout their lives. "I don't want to write about little women, but I want to write novels that are liberating to people's minds."

;

;;

;

;"Children's Book" original English version;;

;

;;

;

;Children's book;;

;

;Continued After "The Virgin in the Garden" and "Still Life", Byatt continued to write about Frederica's various struggles after studying in Cambridge, getting married, and becoming a mother in "The Tower of Babel" in 1996. "People "Always marry with your own yearning for marriage." After experiencing several domestic violence from her husband, Frederica decided to run away. "The place we longed for and tried our best to beautify may be the place we will escape from."

;

;;

;

;The Whistling Woman;;

;

;In the tetralogy finale "The Whistling Woman" (2002) , Byatt continues to tell the story of the lives of free women in the whirlpool of social change. In the 1960s, the emerging television media occupied the forefront of popular culture. The 33-year-old single mother Frederica began to look for new ways to satisfy her intellectual needs. She whistled in the exquisite box of television and became the star of the talk show " The sharp and knowledgeable host of "Through the Looking Glass."

;

; The image of survival and innovation is permeated in the entire novel of "Blowing Woman". In the novel's acknowledgments, Byatt records exchanges with scholars in different fields: snails and genetics, physiology and cognition, the possibilities of television, the ethnology of birds, religious culture, etc. Together with her heroines, she explores new worlds beyond literature and art.

;

;;

;

;Tower of Babel;;

;

;"I read an article that asked:' Is there no support for rationality? 'I guess I'm a rationalist. But I don't think our description of the world is appropriate." Byatt once expressed his distaste for astrology, "I think the zodiac represents The most absurd and arbitrary poetic imaginings of mankind... They are not at all - God help us - a ram or a virgin, they are just a series of dots... I don't understand why humans need these systems, but They just need it."

;

;;

; < p style="color: #999; text-align: center;">;Angels and Insects;;

;

;;

;

;Nightingale Eye;;

;

;The novella "Morpho Eugenia" published in 1992 (collected together with "The Engagement Angel") In "Angels and Insects", Byatt tells the story of William, a naturalist who studied ants and butterflies in South America. After returning to England, he married Eugenia, the daughter of a squire, only to discover that his wife was involved in a terrible relationship with her half-brother. In the end, William broke with the decadent aristocratic life and returned to the primitive Amazon forest...

;

;After the publication of "Morpho Eugenia", critics praised it one after another. Some say that Byatt, through William, put together the fragments of evidence of true evil. God and science, humans and insects, Amazon and England... Byatt uses her intelligence and imagination to weave everything into this gentle and poetic comedy.

;

;Byatt once recalled that after the death of her youngest son Charles, she began to pay attention to comedy, "When you are in a lonely and desolate world, those great comedies - Shakespeare or Jane Austen's Comedy - is strangely becoming more and more important."

;

;In that interview, she mentioned what happened to the heroine Hermione in Shakespeare's late comedy "The Winter's Tale": She was The jealous husband, King Leontes of Sicily, suspected adultery and ordered his death. He survived the catastrophe and was hidden in a sculpture in the cellar. After 16 years, the injustice was overturned and the family was finally reunited.

;

;"I have spent most of my life writing to resist "The Winter's Tale." That kind of deception is so bad! It takes away a woman's most fertile and sexually demanding years. Lock her in a cellar and say it would be nice if she came back as a sculpture, that would be a comfort. It pissed me off."

;

;Byatt admitted that when she was 30, she had I feel scared because "spring comes carelessly, and I will grow old and die", "But now that I have reached such an age, this fact makes me more gratified: even if I die, spring will continue to come... still There are rocks and trees... As long as we don't destroy this planet, spring will continue to come; even if we destroy this planet, maybe spring will continue to appear on other planets..."

; Thu, 23 Nov 2023 15:25:04 +0800 从抢姓“周”到员工互殴，中国金行的“商战”有多激烈？http://www.infzm.com/contents/260958
;;2023-11-23 14:00:00;
;

;Recently, some media released a video saying that a Wanda Plaza in Binzhou, Shandong Province There were many people fighting in the building, and it was suspected that employees of Chow Tai Seng and Lao Fengxiang were fighting each other.

;

;Subsequently, the Bincheng Branch of the Binzhou Municipal Public Security Bureau issued a situation report stating that a dispute occurred between the staff of two stores during the process of soliciting business, and multiple clerks from both parties broke into each other. conflict. Netizens ridiculed Jinxing's fighting behavior to attract business, "Is this a 'business war'?"

;

;In fact, Jinxing's "business war" has always been quite controversial. Fierce, from competing for the surname "Zhou" to now "fighting" to compete for the market. Is such low-quality competition really conducive to the long-term development of domestic jewelry companies?

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;Robbing for the surname "Zhou";

;

;Many consumers who don’t know much about gold brands have inevitably encountered such confusion: Why do so many gold companies have the surname "Zhou"? For example, Chow Tai Fook, Chow Sang Sang, Chow Tai Sang, Saturday Fook, Chow Jin Sang, Chow Pak Fook, Chow Fu Sang... In fact, the founders of many of them are not named "Chow".

;

;Chow Tai Fook is a well-known old brand. As early as 1929, Chow Tai Fook's founder Zhou Zhiyuan founded the first "Chow Tai Fook Gold Store" on Hongde Road, Guangzhou, mainly selling traditional gold jewelry. In the 1930s, due to the current situation, Zhou Zhiyuan moved Chow Tai Fook Bank from Guangzhou to Macau, and later opened a branch in Hong Kong. In 2011, Chow Tai Fook was listed in Hong Kong.

;

;Chow Sang Sang is also an old brand, and the founder is also named Zhou. In 1934, Shunde native Zhou Fangpu founded Jinhang in Guangzhou. From the 1930s to the 1940s, Chow Sang Sang had opened many branches in Hong Kong and Macao. Chow Sang Sang was listed in 1973. It was the first listed gold and jewelry company in Hong Kong.

;

;Chow Tai Sang was established much later than Chow Tai Fook and Chow Sang Sang. It opened its first counter in Wangfujing Department Store in Beijing in 1999 and was listed on the Shenzhen Main Board in 2017. The founder of Zhou Dasheng, Zhou Zongwen, is from Fuqing, Fujian Province, but his surname is indeed "Zhou", so there is nothing wrong with naming the gold bank Zhou Dasheng.

;

;Saturday Fu's surname is "Zhou", which has caused a lot of controversy. In 2004, Li Weipeng and Chen Chuangjin jointly invested in the establishment of Saturday Fortune. In 2005, Chen Chuangjin transferred 50% of the equity held by Li Weipeng to Li Weizhu, Li Weipeng's brother. In other words, the founder and current head of Saturday Fortune is named "Li". The name of Luk Fook will also cause consumers to confuse it with "Luk Fook Jewelry". Lukfook Jewelry was established in Hong Kong in 1991 and listed on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange in 1997. It is more senior than Lukfook.

;

;Some jewelry brands named "Zhou" that appeared after 2000 did not have founders named Zhou. For example, the founders of Zhou Jinsheng are surnamed Li, the founders of Zhou Baifu are surnamed Ye, and the founders of Zhou Fusheng are surnamed Zheng... The founders of these brands must be well aware of whether there is a motive for "taking advantage of" the brand.

;

; Grab the surname "Zhou", reflects a dilemma of domestic jewelry brands: there is still a lack of real jewelry brands in China, and consumers have failed to do some. Some brands generate real loyalty. Gold banks look similar, and consumers don’t care that much. This gives those who “fake” the brand an opportunity.

;

;;

;

;;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;;Seize for the sinking market;

;

;Not only are they competing for the surname "Zhou", China's major gold banks are also competing for the market. This time, the employees of Zhou Taisheng and Lao Fengxiang fought over soliciting business, which is a microcosm of the current situation of jewelry brands competing for the sinking market.

;

;Whether it is Lao Fengxiang, China Gold, or a group of gold banks named "Zhou", they have opened stores in the sinking market. Some netizens posted that their hometown is a small county, but “seven or eight gold stores have opened on one street.”

;

;Chow Tai Fook's first quarter financial report of this year shows that in the first quarter, Chow Tai Fook opened 248 new retail points in the mainland.

;

;Chow Tai Sang's financial report shows that as of the first quarter of 2023, the number of Chow Tai Sang's terminal stores has increased by a net of 133 stores compared with the end of the same period last year, and by a net increase of 21 stores from the beginning of the year.

;

;China Gold's 2023 first quarter financial report shows that China Gold added 21 direct-operated stores and 325 franchise stores in the first quarter; Chow Sang Sang also predicted in the financial report , the group will have a net increase of approximately 100 branches in 2023.

;

;Most of these branches are in third- and fourth-tier cities. For example, in 2022, more than half of Chow Tai Fook's new stores will be located in sinking markets, and the proportion of retail value in third-tier, fourth-tier and other cities has reached one-third.

;

;The reason why we target the sinking market is that on the one hand, the gold and jewelry market in first- and second-tier cities has gradually become saturated, and there is no shortage of gold banks and gold stores. Expand market share and begin to extend to lower-tier markets.

;

;On the other hand, in addition to investment and self-wear, a very critical part of the consumer demand for jewelry is wedding demand. In small counties, there are customary requirements for "three golds" (gold necklaces, gold rings, gold earrings) or "hardwares" (gold bracelets and gold headdresses are added to the "three golds") for weddings. Gold consumption of 10,000 yuan is "standard" in many places. This is a big cake.

;

;However, the sinking of gold brands has also brought new problems. The first thing to bear the brunt is brand management. Many new stores are franchise stores of the brand. The management level of the franchisees varies. Once a problem occurs, it becomes a brand problem and has an impact on the brand image.

;

;What is even more embarrassing is that for consumers in the sinking market, whether you are the senior Lao Fengxiang, Chow Tai Fook, the much younger Chow Tai Seng, or the local There is no fundamental difference between some "no-name" gold banks. Consumers "buy whichever one is cheaper". Anyway, they are all gold, so whoever you buy is not buying.

;

;Therefore, the "business war" of gold banks in the sinking market sometimes involves simply and crudely grabbing customers, which may lead to conflicts.

;

;;Need to work hard on craftsmanship and brand management;

;

;No matter Whether they are competing for the surname "Zhou" or the outrageous conflicts caused by low-quality competition, they have jointly exposed the common dilemma of domestic gold brands: the brand premium is not high, consumers' brand loyalty is not high, and competition is still in the "reckless" stage.

;

;Precisely because the brand premium is not high, the profit margins of domestic gold brands are not high. No matter how the gold price outside rises, buying gold at a gold bank only adds a labor fee to the gold price. According to industry analysis, the retail gross profit margin of gold is 10%-20%.

;

;As for profit margins, they are even lower.

;

;For example, Lao Fengxiang's first quarter financial report for 2023 shows that during the reporting period, the company achieved total operating income of 24.558 billion yuan, net profit attributable to the parent company of 716 million yuan, and a profit margin of 2.9%; China Gold’s operating income in the first quarter of 2023 was 16.139 billion yuan, net profit attributable to the parent company was 300 million yuan, and the profit margin was 1.86%...

;

;In comparison , some foreign luxury jewelry brands, such as Tiffany, Bulgari, and Van Cleef & Arpels, have enviable retail gross profit margins, which can reach 50%-60%. The materials used are obviously ordinary materials that are cheaper than gold, but the price is eye-popping, and consumers still flock to it. Labeling consumers as "foolish people with too much money" is just the self-comfort of those who are lagging behind. Domestic gold brands need to face the gap head-on.

;

;Where do these luxury brands “win”? On the one hand, luxury brand craftsmanship and innovation have elements of originality and originality. For example, Van Cleef & Arpels' "Four-Leaf Clover" series has become a hit because of its classics. Domestic gold brands have also been exploring craftsmanship in recent years. For example, Chow Tai Fook's "ancient gold" is very popular among young consumers.

;

;Unfortunately, following the trend in China is still too serious. Nowadays, almost every mainstream gold brand has an ancient gold series, and the distinction between brands is even worse. Disappeared.

;

;The other is the continuous cultivation of brand image. Nowadays, many gold brands co-brand with brands that young people like, such as Harry Potter and Zootopia. This is of course one way, but the co-branding itself relies more on the power of other brands and cannot be converted into the value of its own brand. . Consumers will buy co-branded models, but they will not become loyal users of gold brands.

;

;In the final analysis, to enhance brand power, we must avoid short-sightedness, avoid eagerness for quick success, avoid following the trend, be calm, sit back, and work hard on craftsmanship. Enhance the artistry and sense of nobility of the brand, making it difficult for other brands to copy it.

;

;Otherwise, if you blindly follow the trend, blindly expand the market and open franchises, it may seem that you have a large market share, but in fact, you will still earn money through hard work. fee. In the end, no matter how fierce the "fight" is, consumers will still buy the cheaper one - and your "fight" is in vain.
